ME201.name: Thermodynamics
ME201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ME201.description: Basic concepts of thermodynamics. Property evaluation of ideal gases and compressible substances. Theory and application of the first and second laws of thermodynamics. Entropy and Carnot efficiency.
ME201.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or CEM 151 or CEM 181H or LB 171) and ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently)) and (PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H or PHY 233B or LB 273)

ME221.name: Statics
ME221.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME221.description: Vector description of forces and moments. Two- and three- dimensional equilibrium of particles and rigid bodies. Analysis of trusses, frames, and machines. Coulomb friction.
ME221.prerequisite: {(PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H) or (PHY 231 and PHY 233B)} and ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently))

ME222.name: Mechanics of Deformable Solids
ME222.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ME222.description: Tension compression and shear stresses. Axially loaded bars. Torsion of circular shafts. Beam theory. Combined stresses. Mohr's circles. Columns.

ME280.name: Graphic Communications
ME280.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME280.description: Computer-aided three-dimensional design. Freehand sketching. Two-and-three-dimensional visualization. Blueprint reading.
ME280.prerequisite: (EGR 100) and ((LB 118 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently)) and ((EGR 102 or concurrently) or (CSE 231 or concurrently))

ME300.name: Professional Issues in Mechanical Engineering
ME300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME300.description: Professional conduct and ethical behavior in the workplace. Practice in professional writing and oral presentation. Global, economic, environmental and societal context of engineering. Contemporary issues in engineering. Group dynamics and working in teams. Intellectual property.
ME300.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
ME300.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME332.name: Fluid Mechanics
ME332.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME332.description: Statics, control volume equations, similitude, and exact fluid solutions. Turbulence, pipe flow, boundary layer flow, compressible flow, and Navier-Stokes equations.
ME332.prerequisite: ME 361 and (CHE 321 or ME 201) and ((ME 391 or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
ME332.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME361.name: Dynamics
ME361.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME361.description: Kinematics of particles, rigid bodies, and mass moments of inertia. Kinetics of particles and rigid bodies. Energy and momentum principles.
ME361.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME370.name: Mechanical Design and Manufacturing I
ME370.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME370.description: Engineering design of machine elements and mechanical systems. Computer-based analysis in support of design. Design for static and fatigue strength, deflection, and reliability.
ME370.prerequisite: (ME 222 and (ME 300 or concurrently) and (ME 391 or concurrently)) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
ME370.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME372.name: Machine Tool Laboratory
ME372.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME372.description: Principles and practice of machine tools. Safety, terminology, measurement, and working procedures for hand and machine tools.
ME372.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME385.name: Computer Aided Design Tools
ME385.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME391.name: Mechanical Engineering Analysis
ME391.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME391.description: Analytical and numerical methods for the modeling and analysis of mechanical engineering systems. Applications to vibrating elements, heat transfer, linear springs, and coupled spring-mass systems.
ME391.prerequisite: (MTH 235 or MTH 340 or MTH 347H) and CSE 231
ME391.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Biosystems Engineering Major or in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME399.name: Special Topics in Mechanical Engineering
ME399.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME399.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses.

ME410.name: Heat Transfer
ME410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME410.description: Steady state and transient heat conduction. Natural and forced convection based on boundary layer theory. Application of Nusselt number correlations. Radiant heat transfer principles and applications including radiation networks.
ME410.prerequisite: (ME 332 or CE 321 or CHE 311) and ME 391
ME410.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME412.name: Heat Transfer Laboratory
ME412.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME412.description: Practices and measurement techniques for heat transfer and thermal systems. Experimental problem solving applied to heat transfer.
ME412.prerequisite: (ME 410 or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
ME412.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME413.name: Cryogenic-Thermal Systems
ME413.description: Low temperature properties of materials and fluids. Introduction to cryogenic liquefaction and refrigeration cycles, separation and purification systems, instrument systems for low temperature measurement, fluid storage and distribution, vacuum technology.
ME413.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME414.name: Mechanical Design of Cryogenic Systems
ME414.description: Engineering mechanical design of cryogenic refrigeration fluid systems. Design, analysis and introduction to ASME codes pertaining to piping systems/components, vacuum insulated transfer-lines, cold boxes, and super-conducting magnet cooling.
ME414.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME416.name: Computer Assisted Design of Thermal Systems
ME416.description: Classifying, cataloging and processing design information. Modeling of thermal equipment. Simulation and optimization of thermal systems. Computer based design projects.
ME416.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME417.name: Design of Alternative Energy Systems
ME417.description: Analysis of alternative energy systems, including ocean, wind, fuel cells, solar, and nuclear. Predictive models for the systems. Design studies.
ME417.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME422.name: Introduction to Combustion
ME422.description: Thermodynamics, chemistry, fluid mechanics, and heat transfer principles applied to combustion.
ME422.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME423.name: Intermediate Mechanics of Deformable Solids
ME423.description: Stress, strain and linearly elastic behavior. Plane stress and plane strain. Torsion. Yield criteria. Elastoplastic behavior of beams, shafts and cylinders. Unsymmetrical bending. Curved beams.
ME423.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME425.name: Experimental Mechanics
ME425.description: Measurement of stress, strain, vibration, and motion using strain gauges, accelerometers, photoelasticity, holography, Moire patterns, laser speckle and electronic imaging. Transducer design.
ME425.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME426.name: Introduction to Composite Materials
ME426.description: Constituents and interfacial bonding. Manufacturing techniques. Microstructure and micromechanics. Theory of anisotropy. Classical laminate theory. Material characterization. Failure and damage. Composite structure design.
ME426.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.

ME433.name: Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics
ME433.description: Theory and application of finite difference and finite volume methods to selected fluid mechanics and heat transfer problems developed based on Euler and Navier-Stokes equations. Application of commercial software to computational fluid dynamics problems.
ME433.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

ME440.name: Aerospace Propulsion
ME440.description: Fundamentals of thrust and propulsion systems, including gas turbines, ramjets, rockets and electric devices. Compressible flow through nozzles and shocks. Cycle analysis of airbreathing jet propulsion and chemical rocket propulsion. Performance and design of propulsion components.
ME440.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME441.name: Aerodynamics and Aircraft Performance
ME441.description: Solutions to inviscid and viscous fluid dynamical equations. Aerodynamics of airfoils, wing and fuselage. Aircraft performance parameters and basics of flight, including cruise, turning, takeoff and landing. Introduction to stability, including control surfaces, longitudinal and lateral stability and power effects.
ME441.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME442.name: Turbomachinery
ME442.description: Applying energy, momentum, and continuity equations of thermo-fluids to turbomachinery. Blade geometry and aerodynamics. Performance and design parameters. Turbomachine design.
ME442.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME444.name: Automotive Engines
ME444.description: Design and development of internal and external combustion engines for vehicular propulsion.
ME444.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME445.name: Automotive Powertrain Design
ME445.description: Design of powertrain systems including piston ring assembly, combustion and induction systems, and transmissions. Performance emission tradeoffs with emphasis on emission control. Detailed design study required.
ME445.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME451.name: Control Systems
ME451.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME451.description: Mathematical modeling of dynamic systems. Standard feedback control formulation. Transient and sinusoidal steady state analysis. Time and frequency domain controller synthesis.
ME451.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME456.name: Mechatronic System Design
ME456.description: Application of imbedded microcontrollers to the design of mechatronic systems. Introduction to feedback and feedforward control concepts. Application to automotive, consumer, industrial and commercial systems.
ME456.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

ME461.name: Mechanical Vibrations
ME461.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME461.description: Modeling and analysis of oscillatory phenomena found in linear discrete and continuous mechanical systems.
ME461.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering major.

ME464.name: Intermediate Dynamics
ME464.description: Kinematics and kinetics of particle and rigid body systems. Virtual work, Lagrangian method, and Euler equations. Basic vibrations of discrete and continuous systems. Elementary wave propagation.
ME464.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME465.name: Computer Aided Optimal Design
ME465.description: Modeling for mechanical design optimization. Algorithms for constrained and unconstrained optimization. Optimality criteria. Optimization using finite element models. Design projects.
ME465.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME470.name: Mechanical Design and Manufacturing II
ME470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME470.description: Kinematic analysis of linkage mechanisms, spur gears and cam-follower systems. Completion of design project.
ME470.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME475.name: Computer Aided Design of Structures
ME475.description: Computational methods for analysis, design, and optimization of structural components. Basic concepts in geometric modeling, finite element analysis, and structural optimization.
ME475.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME477.name: Manufacturing Processes
ME477.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME477.description: Fundamentals of manufacturing processes such as casting, heat treating, particulate processing, forming, machining, joining, and surface processing. Selection of manufacturing processes based on design and materials.
ME477.restrictions: Open to students in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME478.name: Product Development
ME478.description: Simulation of industrial environment for product development. Product concept, design, and manufacturing.
ME478.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

ME481.name: Mechanical Engineering Design Projects
ME481.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME481.description: Application of design concepts in mechanical engineering. Problem definition, design specifications. Modeling and analysis methods. Design optimization, economics, reliability. Manufacturing considerations in design. Capstone design projects.
ME481.prerequisite: (ME 410 and ME 470) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ME489.name: Technical Communication for Engineers
ME489.description: Investigation of technical communication in the engineering workplace. Drafting, revising, and editing communications directed at a variety of audiences. Includes team writing activities, presentations, style, and flow.
ME489.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

ME490.name: Independent Study in Mechanical Engineering
ME490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ME490.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering. Approval of department.

ME491.name: Selected Topics in Mechanical Engineering
ME491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME491.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses.
ME491.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering. Approval of department.

ME494.name: Biofluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer
ME494.description: Applications of fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and thermodynamics to biological processes, including blood flow in the circulatory system, heart function, effects of heating and cooling on cells, tissues, and proteins. Pharmacokinetics.
ME494.prerequisite: (ME 410 or concurrently) or (CHE 311 or concurrently) or (BE 350 or concurrently)
ME494.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering.

ME495.name: Tissue Mechanics
ME495.description: Application of solid mechanics to understanding mechanical responses of biological tissues. Microstructure and biological function for soft and hard connective tissues and muscle.
ME495.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME497.name: Biomechanical Design in Product Development
ME497.description: Biomechanical product design with application to people or animals. Synthesis, prototyping, and analysis of designs. Project management. Market research.
ME497.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

ME800.name: Engineering Analysis
ME800.description: Use of analytical methods of mathematics in engineering applications. Applications of partial differential equations to thermal-fluid and vibration problems, vector calculus and tensor analysis in fluid and solid mechanics, and analytical function theory in mechanics.

ME810.name: Advanced Classical Thermodynamics
ME810.description: Postulational treatment of the laws of thermodynamics. Equilibrium and maximum entropy postulates. Principles for general systems.
ME810.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

ME811.name: Micro-Scale Fluid Mechanics and Heat Transfer
ME811.description: Basic concepts of micro-scale processes. Molecular derivation of the conservation equations of fluid dynamics, Boltzmann equation and Monte-Carlo methods of modern micro-applied science. Theory of micro-scale heat transfer. Applications to fluid mechanics, heat transfer, combustion.

ME812.name: Conductive Heat Transfer
ME812.description: Theory of steady and unsteady heat conduction. Derivation of describing equations and boundary conditions. Numerical methods. Nonlinear problems.

ME814.name: Convective Heat Transfer
ME814.description: Analysis of convective transfer of heat, mass and momentum in boundary layers and ducts. Thermal instability. Free convection.

ME819.name: Combustion
ME819.description: Thermodynamics and chemical kinetics. Multicomponent systems. Premixed and diffusion flames. Flame radiation.

ME820.name: Continuum Mechanics
ME820.description: Mathematical tools of continuum mechanics, stress principles, kinematics of deformation and motion, fundamental laws and equations. Applications in linear elasticity and classical fluids.

ME821.name: Linear Elasticity
ME821.description: Fundamentals of isotropic linear elasticity. Solution of plane elasticity problems. St. Venant bending and torsion. Singular solutions. Basic three-dimensional solutions.

ME824.name: Plasticity
ME824.description: Yield conditions, stress-strain relations, plastic potential, hardening theories, torsion, bending. Thick walled shells under internal pressure. Limit analysis. Slip line theory.

ME825.name: Experimental Mechanics
ME825.description: Measurement of strain, displacement, velocity, and acceleration using resistance strain gages, accelerometers, and related methods. Detailed study of strain gages and accelerometers. Transducer design. Basic modal analysis.
ME825.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

ME826.name: Laminated Composite Materials
ME826.description: Fundamentals of anisotropic elasticity and their application to laminated composite plates. Unique states of deformation, stress, and failure not encountered in isotropic, homogeneous materials.

ME830.name: Fluid Mechanics I
ME830.description: Integral and differential conservation laws, Navier-Stokes' equations, and exact solutions. Laminar boundary layer theory, similarity solutions, and approximate methods. Thermal effects and instability phenomena.

ME832.name: Fluid Mechanics II
ME832.description: Inviscid flow, vortex motion, flow past bodies. Complex variables and conformal mapping. One-dimensional steady and unsteady compressible flow, shock waves and Prandtl-Meyer expansion. Small perturbations theory and method of characteristics.

ME835.name: Turbulence Modeling and Simulation
ME835.description: Basic turbulence theory. Transport equations for calculations of turbulent flows. Current status of modeling and simulation of turbulent flows. Direct numerical simulation. Reynolds-averaged simulations. Large eddy simulation. Probability density function methods in turbulence.

ME836.name: Experimental Methods in Fluid Mechanics
ME836.description: Modern techniques of fluid mechanics measurement and data analysis. Pressure, temperature and velocity measurement techniques. Optical diagnostics.

ME840.name: Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer
ME840.description: Theory and application of finite difference and finite volume methods to selected fluid mechanics and heat transfer models including the full potential flow model, the systems of Euler and Navier-Stokes equations, and turbulence. Grid generation techniques.

ME842.name: Advanced Turbomachinery
ME842.description: Application of energy, momentum, continuity and heat transfer equations to energy transfer and transformation in turbomachinery.
ME842.restrictions: Open only to seniors and graduate students in Mechanical Engineering and Chemical Engineering.

ME851.name: Linear Systems and Control
ME851.description: State models and their stability, controllability, and observability properties. Finding minimal realizations of transfer functions. Design of state and output feedback controllers. Design of state observers. LQ regulator and the Kalman filter. Time-varying systems.

ME853.name: Optimal Control
ME853.description: Static optimization. Nonlinear optimal control of discrete and continuous systems, with specialization to the LQ regulator and tracking. Extending the deterministic results to the Kalman filter and the LQG regulator. Dynamic programming and inequality constraints. Convex optimization and LMI’s.

ME854.name: Robust Control
ME854.description: Linear systems and norms for signals and systems. Investigation of stability and performance of control systems. Model reduction, uncertainty, and robustness. Parameterization of stabilizing controllers, Ricatti equations and related factorizations. Application to H-2, H-infinity, and L-1 control.
ME854.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

ME856.name: Adaptive Control
ME856.description: Real-time parameter estimation. Design of self-tuning regulators and model reference adaptive controllers. Investigation of robustness and robust adaptive controllers. Extension to nonlinear systems.

ME859.name: Nonlinear Systems and Control
ME859.description: Second-order systems and fundamental properties of solutions. Lyapunov stability, input-output stability, passivity, absolute stability, and linearization. Design of feedback controllers using integral control, feedback linearization, sliding mode control, Lyapunov redesign, passivity-based control, and recursive methods. Applications to electrical and mechanical systems.
ME859.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering.

ME860.name: Theory of Vibrations
ME860.description: Discrete systems and continua. Analytical mechanics. Variational principles. Modal analysis. Function spaces. Eigenfunction expansions. Integral transforms. Stability. Approximations. Perturbations.

ME861.name: Advanced Dynamics
ME861.description: Dynamics of systems of particles and rigid bodies. Energy and momentum principles. Lagrangian and Hamiltonian methods. Euler angles. Applications in system dynamics and vibrations.

ME863.name: Nonlinear Vibrations
ME863.description: Perturbation methods. Weakly nonlinear partial and ordinary differential equations. Modal interactions, internal tuning, saturation, sub/super/combination resonances, jump phenomenon. Nonlinear normal modes.

ME872.name: Finite Element Method
ME872.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME872.description: Theory and application of the finite element method to the solution of continuum type problems in heat transfer, fluid mechanics, and stress analysis.

ME874.name: Analysis of Metal Forming and Manufacturing Processes
ME874.description: Review of fundamental knowledge in mechanics, materials and numerical analysis. Modeling, simulation and analysis of metal forming and manufacturing processes.

ME875.name: Optimal Design of Mechanical Systems
ME875.description: Optimal design for static and dynamic response of mechanical and structural systems. Necessary and sufficient conditions for optimality. Discrete and continuous parameter problems. Sensitivity of response to design variations. Algorithms.

ME881.name: Cardiovascular Mechanics
ME881.description: Solid and fluid mechanics of the cardiovascular system. Computational modeling tools for simulating hemodynamics and stress-mediated growth and remodeling in patient-specific geometry.

ME891.name: Selected Topics in Mechanical Engineering
ME891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME891.description: Special topics in mechanical engineering of current importance.

ME892.name: Mechanical Engineering Seminar
ME892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ME892.description: Attend and present seminars in order to develop research and presentation skills relevant to mechanical engineering.

ME898.name: Master's Project Research
ME898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ME898.description: Master's degree Plan B individual student project
ME898.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Mechanical Engineering major. Approval of department.

ME899.name: Master's Thesis Research
ME899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

ME921.name: Nonlinear Elasticity
ME921.description: Kinematics and kinetics of large deformations. Incompressible and compressible finite elasticity. Solution of basic problems. Nonuniqueness, stability, and buckling. Singular fields near cracks and flaws.

ME922.name: Thermoelasticity and Viscoelasticity
ME922.description: Thermomechanics of solids. Theory of thermoelasticity. Boundary value problems in thermoelasticity. Linear and nonlinear viscoelasticity. Model representation. Boltzmann superposition. Correspondence principle.

ME940.name: Selected Topics in Thermal Science
ME940.description: Conduction, convection, radiation, phase change and interactive combined modes of heat transfer. Mass transfer. Irreversible thermodynamics.
ME940.restrictions: Open only to Mechanical Engineering majors.

ME960.name: Selected Topics in Vibrations
ME960.description: Current topics of interest to the student and faculty.

ME961.name: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
ME961.description: Qualitative theory of dynamical systems applied to physical system models. Bifurcation theory for continuous and discrete-time systems, chaos, the Smale horseshoe, Melnikov's method, and nonlinear data analysis.

ME990.name: Independent Study in Mechanical Engineering
ME990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ME990.description: Individualized study of a current problem in mechanical engineering.

ME999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
ME999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
